comments.author: JamesMichaelDoyle

comments.text:
Americans, meet Albertans. Aren't they great?

If only I weren't Albertan myself, but I was born in Edmonton where all the 
communists live.

Joking aside, it amazes me Republicans react to Obamacare the way they do, 
it isn't even a proper public healthcare system. Don't get me wrong, it 
sounds like it helps people immensely. But at the end of the day it still 
upholds the private system, but that might just be what works for you, and 
that's perfectly alright. I don't want to sound all 
everything-in-Canada-is-awesome, because at the moment the opposite is 
currently the case. But I don't pay anything for my healthcare, other than 
taxes, which despite popular belief are no higher than they are in the US. 
A life saver considering I have to deal with a medical condition 
constantly. 

However if the Reform, I mean, Conservative's stay in power, that could 
change. Slowly but surely eroding away at the public system.﻿

concern. But that's just my observations.

Whether or not it matters, I feel the Republican party is going to split 
soon. If not this cycle then the next one for sure.
comments.author: LEDN42

comments.text:
+LEDN42
Well, there is a small chance that that was the reason. But how do you 
explain that the GOP is still against Obamacare today, even though it costs 
less than initially estimated?
The answer is simple. Today, only 5% of US citizens are aware that 
Obamacare is less expensive than expected. But with every day that goes by, 
more and more people read about this fact; and there is a good chance that 
come the next presidential elections, 20% or even 30% will know this fact. 
And they all will vote DEM then. A catastrophe for the GOP.

comments.author: John Smith

comments.text:
The problem is it is not perfect because the Republicans did not 
participate with the law and Obama had to do some things like gives to the 
insurance companies which made it  a less than perfect plan but it is 
certainly far better than anything we had before.  People are now able to 
get coverage.  Businesses who could not provide coverage now have employees 
who can remain healthy and have coverage.   

President Obama knew that he needed to get it passed and then make 
adjustments along with war to improve it.  I know people who are dropping 
their coverage and getting coverage on an exchange which is cheaper. I know 
many of the independent contractors I hire who now have insurance when in 
the past they never could afford it so this is a small business godsend. 

Its interesting that the many polls of business people I have looked at, 
being a business person, show that they are positive about the future of 
our country and see business growing.  Some have stated issues with 
Obamacare but it seems more about misinformation that is being pushed in 
these circles with many of them being Republican.  

It is truly an Affordable Care act to make insurance affordable to people. 
 Funny how car insurance is mandatory and young people are the most risky 
coverage so have the highest premiums.  Health insurance is almost the 
opposite with the young being less in need of coverage.  Now that many I 
know can afford it because it is the many times lower than cable or cell 
phone they are confident that they do not have to fear the broken leg or 
illness.﻿

comments.author: Adrian Lackey

comments.text:
For the first time in 15 years, my company's heath care plan went DOWN in 
cost to us per week after Obamacare took affect.  Coincidence?  I'm not an 
expert in health care, but it sure has NOT hurt me personally, or my 
coworkers. I do know that one of the theories of Obamacare was the more 
people in the system, the more competition among insurers for new 
customers, then hopefully they would lower their costs to compete.  Plus, 
laws were enacted that reigned in insurer spending on administration and 
everything NON-healthcare related.  Whatever the theory, its working. Time 
will continue to tell as long as the Retardicans don't mess with it.﻿

and control E3Bs that follow and those are attributed to *any* US President 
and their family wherever the go in the world.

When a President travels he takes a huge aerial entourage that transports 
him and his stuff and allows him to communicate with and command the 
largest most expensive military in the world. Do you think its cheap to fly 
half a dozen big heavy planes around? With all the staff, security and 
armoured vehicles its like moving a small military expedition force around.
